section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: A hands-on programming section covering the fundamentals of variables, data types, and basic operations in Python. Students will learn to declare variables, understand different data types, perform type conversion, and work with user input through practical exercises.
learning_objectives: Declare and assign values to variables using proper Python syntax
Identify and use core Python data types including integers, floats, strings, and booleans
Perform type conversion between different data types
Utilize input() function to capture and process user input

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to declare variables using valid Python identifiers and assign values using the assignment operator.
key_topics: Python variable naming rules and conventions

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create three variables: one for your name, one for your age, and one for your favorite color. Print each variable's value to the console.
Create a variable called 'score' with an initial value of 10. Print it, then reassign it to 25 and print the new value.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to perform basic arithmetic operations with integer and float data types.

exercises.exercise_instructions: Convert a temperature of 98.6 degrees Fahrenheit to Celsius using the formula: celsius = (fahrenheit - 32) * 5/9. Store both values in variables and print the result.
Calculate the area and perimeter of a rectangle with length 8.5 and width 5.2. Store each calculation in separate variables and print both results.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to create string variables and perform basic string operations and concatenation.
key_topics: String creation with single and double quotes

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create three string variables for first name, last name, and a greeting message. Concatenate them to form a complete greeting and print it.
Create a string variable containing a single word and use the repetition operator to print it 5 times in a row without spaces.

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to convert between data types and work with boolean values and comparisons.
key_topics: Type conversion functions: int(), float(), str()

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a string variable containing '123', convert it to an integer, add 7 to it, then convert the result back to a string and print it.
Create two variables with different numeric values. Write and print the results of three different comparison operations between them (e.g., greater than, equal to, not equal to).

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will be able to capture user input and process it with appropriate data types.
key_topics: Processing numeric input with type conversion

exercises.exercise_instructions: Prompt the user to enter two numbers. Convert the inputs to floats, calculate their sum, product, and average, then print all three results.
Ask the user for their name, age, and favorite food. Create a personalized message that incorporates all three pieces of information and print it.
